nodes.name: Emily Kemp
nodes.title: Team Leader
nodes.description: As our powerhouse of leadership, Emily exudes confidence and reliability. From biology to external connections she oversees all of the City of London iGEM team's workings, and ensures that this machine is always efficient and productive, much like her team on the football field. Whether it be telling the team off for not doing the work, or telling the team off for not communicating, Emily's always ready to step in when others won't.

nodes.name: Ryan Yapa
nodes.title: Deputy Lead: CLS
nodes.description: Where to start with Ryan? While I have never seen anyone do so much work for something they seem so dispassionate about, Ryan's contribution to iGEM has been invaluable, pioneering the project from the beginning. In the process of trying to be more like Julian Chen, he has achieved much in his time in iGEM. Following in the footsteps of who he believes to be the greatest leader of all time, Ryan has ruled CLS iGEM with an iron fist. He has told many lies: that he doesn't need a calculator, that he'd be 'happy' to help and that Luke Wallis's prediction wouldn't come true. Accidental flirting seems to come incredibly naturally to him, and the rest of the time he enjoys diplomatically scheming with Zac on the café balcony like he's the best thing since sliced bread. Full Windsor's have never looked so dapper, but given our school uniform is not Tommy Hilfiger, the jury's still out over whether he's a fan. Ryan's music taste is archaic; from his love of the Dancing Queen to the band Queen, he refuses to move into the current century. Outside of the classroom, Ryan watches Formula One religiously, and he's just hoping the colour of our iGEM medal this year is better than the participation one Mercedes will receive this season. We all feel so... blessed to be working with him!

nodes.name: Charlotte Henderson
nodes.title: Deputy Lead: CLSG
nodes.description: As a deputy leader, Charlotte has been vital in shaping this year's CLS iGEM team. She has successfully led subgroups and is a strong asset to our biology team. Charlotte works hard to bring the team together and ensure strong communication and understanding of all aspects of the project. In her free time, Charlotte loves to play the guitar and is often involved in sports such as netball. She hopes to continue to work closely with the whole team and provide support to ensure Genoswitch is successful.

nodes.name: Astrid Brodie
nodes.title: Co-Head of Biology
nodes.description: Who would've thought that Astrid's newfound love of running would actually have come in useful, from running to the labs in the (misguided) hope of being on time, to running boxes of equipment across London dressed as the next James Bond. Her work in the labs has been pivotal, especially through incubating our bacteria (shaken, not stirred). Her commitment to the project knows no limit, although nothing could ever top the Instagram account that she set up for her dog. Having worked on Genoswitch since the beginning, she is well versed and keeps everything on a tight leash, except her equipment which she manages to consistently under order. Astrid owes all her success to the wondeful lab techs who have stepped in to make the project possible.

nodes.name: Yilu Lim
nodes.title: Co-Head of Biology
nodes.description: Despite never making a single accurate shot whilst playing GTA V, Yilu's gaming ability is unparalleled. These skills are applicable to all aspects of co-leading our iGEM biology team, such as being able to retain her humility whilst answering questions she has no clue about. Her love of biology far surpasses all else, most notably her common sense when being told she's 'taking on too much work'.

nodes.name: James Cahill
nodes.title: Co-Head of Hardware
nodes.description: James' role at CLS as 'unofficial IT support' for the past 6 years has paid dividends over time, resulting in him being one of the heads of hardware, and a leading member of the software team. His dedication is evident in his tireless efforts to design schematics for our luminometer and repeatedly amazing us with his seemingly limitless knowledge of coding while programming its firmware. On top of all that, he's been lending a helping hand to Rishabh with bits and pieces of the software, making him an absolute pleasure to work with. James is our team's secret weapon, and we're lucky to have him!

nodes.name: Edwin Hadass
nodes.title: Co-Head of Hardware
nodes.description: If you take a mad scientist and surgically drain away his personality, then you're only a coat of grey paint away from something approximating Edwin. Eddie is the co-head of hardware, a role he is primarily qualified for due to his ability to jump between different concepts and goals with ease, always ready to contribute somebody else's ideas to the project. Edwin's time at City has been as dazzling as his smile, with his biggest achievement being an appearance in the school's publicity campaign as a second former, playing table tennis with Louis. Insofar as he has passions, Edwin is passionate about changing the world for the better; the anti-manspreading chair he designed for art GCSE worked very well indeed, and his heroic efforts to make the microbial fuel cell he helped develop produce energy at only £50000 per Watt (only slightly more than British Gas) are nothing short of inspirational.

nodes.name: Philomene Lloyd
nodes.title: Co-Head of Human Practices
nodes.description: Philo is our fabulous co-head of Human Practices, without her we would have been stuck with nowhere to do our lab work and no money (which would have been slightly less than ideal). When she's not doing iGEM, she continues to live up to CLSG's three R's: respectfulness, resourcefulness and a ridiculous love of running (we’re still not sure why…). With Philo at the helm of human practices, our iGEM team has formed valuable connections with other teams and individuals, and has survived the highs and lows of our project.

nodes.name: Zac Robb
nodes.title: Co-Head of Human Practices
nodes.description: With his glaring hatred of socialism and love for economies of scale, Zac has been steadfastly guiding City iGEMs economic progress. He has embraced the maxim 'work smarter not harder' alongside its key tenets of delegation, procrastination, weaselling his way out of events he organised himself. Combined with his admiration for Blairite economics, this has enabled Zac to run the tight ship necessary in the often tumultuous environment of an iGEM team.

nodes.name: Carter Stevens
nodes.title: Head of Modelling
nodes.description: While he is the head of modelling, Carter's ability to run an interesting discourse on many intellectual topics ranging from Quantum theory and Electrodynamics to the efficacy of spaceflight or just plain old Star Wars is an impressive sight to behold. However his attempts to introduce pantera to a wider audience have not been so successful (what even is a pantera?). Although his hand-written mathematical hieroglyphs may be indecipherable to the uninitiated, the now-iconic yellow paper on which he presents his findings has become a symbol for the academic excellence towards which every member of City iGEM strives.

nodes.name: Rishabh Das
nodes.title: Head of Software
nodes.description: Rishabh is our resident Prince of Puns and connoisseur of interesting icebreakers. His proficiency in tinkering with video games (resulting in him having more Skyrim mods than millimetres in height) have translated well into his quick wit, sharp pen, and aptitude for solving challenging problems. His ability to adopt sleek graphic styles and write efficient (albeit poorly documented) code have resulted in both breath-taking pieces of media and breakthroughs in the bio-software of our project, making him a truly invaluable asset to the team.

descriptionMd.plain: David has dedicated his heart and soul to the success of Genoswitch ever since the failure of his valiant attempt to culture a project aiming to cure phenylketonuria. 'Phenylkure', his brainchild (named with the finesse of a portmanteau-crazed geneticist who moonlights as a stand-up comedian), had a logo designed by Rishabh which stole David's heart, although at times it seemed that he liked that logo a bit too much. Unfortunately, Phenylkure was a hard cell to our team leaders, however, it has not dissuaded David as he has proven that his knack for finding miRNA for our blood-based diagnostic tools truly runs in his DNA. His skills in the wetlab have also been A+, when he needs to B. Cereus. He can accomplish the task at hand with focus sharper than a restriction enzyme. Overall, it cannot be understated how much of a dopamine rush it has been to work with David - I shall halt my scribbles here, lest the biology puns become cornea and cornea by the word.
descriptionMd.html: David has dedicated his heart and soul to the success of Genoswitch ever since the failure of his valiant attempt to culture a project aiming to cure phenylketonuria. 'Phenylkure', his brainchild (named with the finesse of a portmanteau-crazed geneticist who moonlights as a stand-up comedian), had a logo designed by Rishabh which stole David's heart, although at times it seemed that he liked that logo a bit too much. Unfortunately, Phenylkure was a hard cell to our team leaders, however, it has not dissuaded David as he has proven that his knack for finding miRNA for our blood-based diagnostic tools truly runs in his DNA. His skills in the wetlab have also been A+, when he needs to B. Cereus. He can accomplish the task at hand with focus sharper than a restriction enzyme. Overall, it cannot be understated how much of a dopamine rush it has been to work with David - I shall halt my scribbles here, lest the biology puns become cornea and cornea by the word.

nodes.name: Evelyn Cole
nodes.title: Biology Team Member
nodes.description: TBD

nodes.name: Hester Evans
nodes.title: Biology Team Member
nodes.description: Being part of the biology team, Hester plays an essential role in the iGEM team, making sure the wheels keep turning even when things get a bit challenging, as they often do. From abruptly terminating research projects and making quick turn arounds, to doing repeat after repeat in the lab to achieve the required results, Hester has certainly developed her virtue of patience through iGEM. However, the skills Hester has learned and acquired through this experience have changed the way she works in a team and learns from others, and she aspires to use these important skills when studying a chemistry degree in the future.

nodes.name: Harry Glyn
nodes.title: Biology Team Member
nodes.description: As one of the few sane realists in the team, Harry never fails to steady the iGEM ship with his (mostly) calm and considered remarks. Neither abrasive nor stagnant, Harry keeps the project – and its members' morale – moving in the right direction. In his free time, he enjoys going for a run or getting stuck into a killer sudoku, with the occasional spot of politics if the opportunity presents itself. After iGEM (although once an iGEMmer, always an iGEMmer), Harry hopes to study Medicine, and put his newfound research skills to the test at medical school. We wish him all the best!

nodes.name: Olivia Gordon
nodes.title: Biology Team Member
nodes.description: What Livvy lacks in height, she makes up for with her biological ability. From detecting frameshift mutations, to discovering that many researched miRNAs are upregulated as a result of many diseases, there always seems to be a problem to be solved. Livvy's greatest achievement to date is probably naming the project, which despite her best efforts, is always pronounced wrong. Despite all of this, she has thoroughly enjoyed being a part of the iGEM team, with an aim to continue research projects in the future while studying medicine.

nodes.name: Lola Idle
nodes.title: Biology Team Member
nodes.description: It may be in her last name, but in real life Lola's no idler when it comes to detailed and diligent research. With roots in the ideas team providing necessary 'escape routes' in case all goes downhill, Lola has greatly enjoyed being a part of the iGEM Biology team, and is looking forward to witnessing its success. She's looking forward to adapting the skills picked up along the way in a chemistry degree post CLSG.

nodes.name: Augustine Louvrier
nodes.title: Biology Team Member
nodes.description: Although not being able to participate in quite as many labs as she would have liked (zero), Augustine is a lively member of the biology team. She enjoys all aspects of her role in the team, and hopes to use the skills she has acquired doing iGEM in her chemistry degree and beyond. Still grieving the initial project that she was working on, she has found ways to continue using her effective research skills that she had acquired at the time. Being in the biology team has been a fantastic opportunity to discover new aspects of the subject that Augustine had not been able to explore in class (she had been able to explore them at the university of Chicago last year).

nodes.name: Oluwatobi Sanyaolu
nodes.title: Biology Team Member
nodes.description: Tobi is a reliable member of our biology team and has been a bit of a utility player filling in when random tasks need to be done. Whilst he may have more notable roles in school, such as being the Head Boy at CLS, and as a result has to deal with always being called 'THE' by Louis, his ever-smiling presence seems to have taken well to being a cog in our iGEM machine. Tobi plans to take use that he learns from iGEM in his future career in medicine.

nodes.name: Matthew Spreadbury
nodes.title: Biology Team Member
nodes.description: Throughout this years' iGEM effort, Matthew has been a crucial component of the biology team. He has a knack for finding obscure Yugoslavian research papers, a skill which has been put into good use in the research aspect of the biology team's efforts. When not absorbed in a paper, he is likely to be found staring at old pottery, whilst resolutely assuring anyone who will listen that Exekias is far superior to whomever else is suggested. He aims to go on to university to study a bioscience, and apply the skills learnt from his time in iGEM there.

nodes.name: Sophie Yuldasheva
nodes.title: Biology Team Member
nodes.description: Matriculating over from iGEM team 2022, Sophie brings with her a natural affinity towards all things biology. She has enjoyed developing the initial ideas for the team, whilst simultaneously conquering levels in 'Gardenscapes'. Unfortunately, whilst a master gardener on screen, she struggles to touch grass in the real world - spending most of her time buried under the sheets (of scientific papers, that is).

nodes.name: Tristan Cassidy
nodes.title: Hardware Team Member
nodes.description: Now as you can see from his state of dress in this image, Tristan isn't known for his ability to tuck in his shirt, but rather for his attention to detail and cunning eye for improvements and solutions. He's always willing to pick up any task no matter its size in order to help the team out and increase his contribution to the team.  Alongside giving him a chance to explore his interests further, iGEM has forced him to improve his patience as he eagerly awaits for the hardware testing to start, with him passing the time with an unhealthy addiction to FM. Despite his addictions, once he learns that sleeves are meant to be buttoned and shirts tucked in, he will go far in whatever he chooses to do in the scientific fields or beyond.

nodes.name: Qifan Guo
nodes.title: Hardware Team Member
nodes.description: Despite the fact that Qifan hasn't been seen with a done-up top button at school for the past 3 years, even though the time and effort it would take him to do it would be 100x easier than writing this sentence, Qifan is always willing to complete any tasks that he is given in iGEM, irrespective of its complexity. Although he may have a clumsy appearance, he has an industrious work ethic in iGEM, and is always willing to learn more, and not many would be able to survive as many of Li Sen's hieroglyphic lectures on group theory with such poise as he did. His research into the luminometer was essential for our project's success, and he is hoping to take the lessons that he has learnt from iGEM to study maths at university.

nodes.name: David Kang
nodes.title: Hardware Team Member
nodes.description: David Kang's life is dominated, to an almost obsessive degree, by the pursuit of order. Whether he is playing his oboe in harmony with the rest of the school orchestra, or marching in unison with the rest of the CCF, whether he is solving near-impossible BMO questions or streamlining his discourse to almost NPC-like levels of purity, David is always logical, always ordered, and (like his GCSE grades) always perfect.  Although this attitude may have taken its toll on his sense of humour, he is still a man (albeit a non-playable one) to be admired. David has bled, toiled, tore and sweated for the iGEM cause, working tirelessly and cheerfully to silently slip by whenever tasks are assigned to the hardware team.

nodes.name: Louis Cahill
nodes.title: Human Practices Team Member
nodes.description: Louis can often be seen power-walking around CLS, racing to complete a to-do-list that would make your eyes hurt, with an inbox fuller than his bag, whilst often assisting staff and pupils with their technological qualms and queries. Louis has been a valued member of our Human Practices Team this year. Alongside his twin brother James, and Rishabh, Louis has played a leading role in creating this year's team wiki. He also helped to create our two team videos, and assisted Anni with the social media campaign. He has a passion for biology, and a genuine interest in the personal and communicative areas of science, and very much wishes to study medicine in the future.

nodes.name: Samaara Chaudhary
nodes.title: Human Practices Team Member
nodes.description: Although Samaara does not do economics A level, nor has she ever shown an interest in anything vaguely related to the subject, she has somehow wrangled her way into the Human Practices team. Drafting some wiki articles and creating surveys, she has made a valuable contribution to our project. No matter what she does, Samaara is always ready to further the learning of others, even being so gracious and humble as to donate her Oestrogen regulation project to the next generation as a preparatory exercise.

nodes.name: Louis Chenot
nodes.title: Human Practices Team Member
nodes.description: Although he is the Director of a General Hospital in Two-Point Hospital, Louis limits himself to the public relations side of the iGEM project, always keen to write a sufficiently waffly paragraph or two about any topic that is given to him. Some of his interests in the field include genetic engineering and the moral and ethical questions surrounding the wider adoption of biotechnology in society, and the potential ramifications this could have for our modern legal systems. Not only is this last sentence entirely true, it is also a perfect example of Louis' waffle-ability. He looks forward to continuing in this stead over the coming year!

nodes.name: Anni Moodie
nodes.title: Human Practices Team Member
nodes.description: After being specially appointed as one of the team's social media managers, Anni put her heart and soul into making one instagram post and then vanished into thin air. She's lucky everyone gave in their descriptions so quickly, she would've had to make Louis chase people up for MONTHS if not. Her other efforts include (and are limited to) the NICE guidelines report, which was done to an exceptional standard. The human practices team is glad to have someone as dedicated as Anni on their side.

nodes.name: Ama Anamoah
nodes.title: Modelling Team Member
nodes.description: TBD

nodes.name: Li Sen Tan
nodes.title: Modelling Team Member
nodes.description: Despite being the root cause of the greatest waste of time and effort the iGEM team faced, once it was clear that microbial fuel cells weren't capable of fuelling anything more than Edwin's anger towards the project, Li Sen quickly turned to join the modelling team. Though the maths was not nearly as pure as he would like, Li Sen made sure to spend his time wisely, devoting many hours to learning the multivariable calculus required to understand any of Carter’s calculations. Li Sen has a variety of interests outside of the classroom, including but not limited to algebra, number theory, topology, Galois theory and Tetris. Through iGEM, Li Sen has gained an appreciation for the more applied sides of maths and science, and hopes to continue to develop his knowledge by studying maths at university.

nodes.name: Elizabeth Sullivan
nodes.title: Software Team Member
nodes.description: After saving the entirety of iGEM by jumping in when someone tragically left, she has arguably does less than any other member ever has in the history of the team (aside from a single golden nugget of knowledge). In doing so she has perfectly filled the non-existent boots of her predecessor.

nodes.name: Anushri Ajitsaria
nodes.title: J6 / Year 12 Team Member
nodes.description: Much like all the avid Year 12 members of the team, Anushri is committed to putting her all in this team. Riveted by the fascinating world of synthetic biology and genetic engineering, Anushri also thoroughly enjoys the hardware and engineering aspect of the project. The Fifth Form project on oestrogen has really taken Anushri by interest, with its niche aspects as well as numerous opportunities to learn and develop further. The collaborative environment of iGEM is a comfort for her as well as it allows her to exchange insights with peers and broaden her perspectives. If the experience of iGEM so far has taught her anything - it's that she's going to love it.

nodes.name: Ewan Frazao Pinheiro
nodes.title: J6 / Year 12 Team Member
nodes.description: Ewan joined CLS in 2018 and has loved not only STEM but humanities, languages and music as well throughout his time up to the GCSEs. He also loves football, tennis and kickboxing, and tries to maintain non-STEM interests as best he can. For A-levels, he chose maths, further maths, physics and biology, focussing on his main interest of science. Ewan aims to help the iGEM project both on the design and the modelling aspects, combining his A-levels and his shared passion for biology and physics. He joined the team for the rare experience of, and the opportunity to work within the world of genetic engineering, and help find solutions to genuine problems, which has always been a goal for him.

nodes.name: Lili Ghaffari-Gandy
nodes.title: J6 / Year 12 Team Member
nodes.description: Eager to plunge into the depths of synthetic biology and develop her skills to leverage biology to engineer solutions to relevant, real life problems, ranging from healthcare to chemical synthesis, Lili joined the City of London iGEM team. Determined to pursue a career in medicine in the near future, this year’s Fifth Form oestrogen project has proved to be a perfect fit for her interests, and she has thoroughly enjoyed spending countless hours critically analysing peer-reviewed journals which often leave her incredibly curious and with more questions than answers…Throughout her experience so far, Lili has not only been able to stretch her intellectual horizons of the human body, but has also been gifted with the invaluable opportunity of improving her skills in collaborative ethical communication, ensuring that all members of the group have a solid, mutual understanding. Now that her interest has been piqued even further, Lili cannot wait to see what the future of iGEM holds.

nodes.name: Reya Karpe
nodes.title: J6 / Year 12 Team Member
nodes.description: Amongst the other assiduous year 12s, Reya joined this year's J6 team looking to expand her knowledge on biomedical sciences. Reya's passion for biomed stemmed from a young age when she discovered through the manipulation of four simple bases, one could alter someone's life for the better. From then on, her infatuation transformed into a keen ambition to utilise the building bricks of life to improve the state of millions. Attuning her interest through further research and internships, this ambition evolved into a keen desire to delve further into the complex nature of biomedical sciences. In Reya's current project, the team is attempting to theorise a pill that could regulate oestrogen levels in menopausal women. This revolutionary pill would only need to be taken once and develop into a self-sustaining system, working in tandem with the body to regulate oestrogen levels. Admittedly, biomedicine presents its own set of unique challenges. However, the fulfilment one carries knowing they can help thousands of people only serves to fuel Reya's motivation.

nodes.name: Angus Lusty
nodes.title: J6 / Year 12 Team Member
nodes.description: Angus discovered an early love of science when he first found that cress does indeed germinate in a dark cupboard. Other recent successes have included a homemade, lockdown dissection of a lamb’s heart, making his own yoghurt (which got better when he remembered to put the seal on), and wildly oversized scones. In more lab-based environments, he discovered the smell of burnt eyebrows, blazers, and probably some other stuff.

nodes.name: Rafael Pearce
nodes.title: J6 / Year 12 Team Member
nodes.description: TBD

nodes.name: Sean Richardson
nodes.title: J6 / Year 12 Team Member
nodes.description: TBD

nodes.name: Irene Selvin
nodes.title: J6 / Year 12 Team Member
nodes.description: Alongside other diligent, dedicated individuals in the City of London iGEM team sharing an unwavering commitment to synthetic biology's transformative potential, Irene partook in research. The Year 12 team embarked on developing a probiotic that alleviates symptoms of menopause - which could revolutionise the lives of many women worldwide. This project has given her the freedom to peruse peer-reviewed journals, improve her ability to communicate complex ideas with clarity, and pursue a greater understanding of the human body. As an aspiring medic, Irene particularly enjoyed delving deeper into biochemical pathways, homeostatic mechanisms and intricate physiology that left her awestruck. She hopes to walk away with a greater insight into genetic engineering.

nodes.name: William Tibbits
nodes.title: Primary PI
nodes.description: TBD

nodes.name: Simon Hall
nodes.title: Secondary PI
nodes.description: TBD

nodes.name: City of London School for Girls
City of London School for Boys
